Schmidt COLLEGE OF ARTS AND LETTERS SUB MENU Department of Theatre & Dance About Us Mission and Policies Our Faculty and Staff Our Graduate Students Study With Us Beyond Classroom Advisory Boards Internship Student Organizations Theatre Lab - Our Professional Theatre in Residence Course Catalog Silent Degree Advisor BFA Program Auditions and Interviews Production Performance Opportunities Dance Concert Auditions Production Auditions Student Produced Theatre Opportunities Upcoming Productions Box Office Contact Directions Past Productions Photo Gallery Make A Gift Outside Affiliations Cultural Consortium of Greater Boca Raton Theatre League of South Florida Florida Theatre Conference University/Resident Theatre Association Faculty and Staff Our faculty are active members nationwide and in the South Florida theatre community. They are respected members of professional organizations including Actors Equity Association, Screen Actors Guild, Society of American Fight Directors, United Scenic Artists, National Dance Education Organization, Florida Dance Educators, Florida Association for Theatre Education, and the Voice and Speech Trainers Association. We have a wide breadth of training in performance techniques including certifications in several movement and voice disciplines including Laban, Alexander, Fitzmaurice and Linklater, as well as in Stage Combat. Our ongoing professional work and association keeps us innovative and current in our classrooms, studios, and in our productions, and is a direct benefit to the strength of our undergraduate programs. Its these connections that allow us to bring in the fields top people for Master Classes and as Eminent Scholars, bringing their real-life knowledge to the curriculum. Whether you prefer
                                       a phone or video conversation, or coming in person to meet with our team and tour
                                       our facilities, we are ready to connect any way that best fits your preference. Graduate Degree Programs One-on-One Conversation Schedule a conversation at a time and format that works best with your availability
                                                to learn more about the program features. Video Meeting Phone Call In-Person Boca Raton Campus Davie/Broward Campus  coming soon West Palm Beach Downtown Office Information Session Register for an upcoming group session to learn about the program features, flexibility,
                                                resources, enrollment steps, funding options, and speak with alumni. Doctoral Degree Program Schedule a conversation Attend an Information Session Professional Development Programs Call Our Office: 561-297-6000 Email Us: professionaldevelopment@fau.edu Learn More About Our Professional Development Programs Corporate Training Call Our Office: 561-297-4819 Email Us: pgarrido@fau.edu Learn More About Corporate Training Walk-In Meetings Boca Raton Campus: We encourage prospective students, employers and visitors to connect with our dedicated
                                       Executive Education team. You will have the opportunity to tour our impressive facilities,
                                       review the program features, and discuss your background and professional aspirations. Our dedicated advisors look forward to connecting with you and are available Monday
                                       through Friday, 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM. Please contact our office if you would like to schedule your visit. If these times
                                          do not work with your schedule, please connect with us through one of the other options
                                          listed above. Phone : (561) 297-6000 Email Us: ExecEdAdmissions@fau.edu Address: Florida Atlantic University College of Business 777 Glades Rd. Building 103 Boca Raton, FL 33431 USA Directions to the Boca Raton Campus: Exit I-95 at Glades (Exit 45) / (Exit 75) from the Turnpike. Head EAST on Glades to10th/Broward
                                       Ave (the first and main entrance to FAU). Turn left into campus and continue on Broward
                                       Ave until the road curves right. Make the first LEFT, after the road curves into the
                                       parking garage/white building complex adjacent to the stadium and across from the
                                       College of Business, Office Depot Center. Park on the second floor in one of the Executive Education visitor parking spaces
                                       and take the elevator or stairs to the ground-level entrance. If visitor parking is
                                       unavailable, you may park in an open space and speak to the Executive Education main
                                       office/front desk staff about parking validation. Alumni Engagement Visit our Executive Alumni Engagement webpage to stay connected with FAU Executive Education through events, campus visits, and
                                       mentorship opportunities. All graduates of our degree and certificate programs are
                                       part of our alumni community. For alumni-related questions, reach out to us at ExecEdOwls@FAU.edu . Employers/Recruiters Are you an employer or recruiter? Speak with our Career Specialists to recruit Executive
                                       Education students and graduates. Jennifer L. Bloom, Ed.D. joined the Department of Educational Leadership and Research Methodology at Florida Atlantic University in August 2015. She serves as a Professor and Founder of the FAU Office of Appreciative Education. Dr. Bloom is a co-founder of the Appreciative Advising and Appreciative Education movements. She established the Appreciative Advising Institute, the Appreciative Education Conference, the Appreciative Advising Online Course, the process for Certifying Appreciative Advisers, and other exciting initiatives related to Appreciative Advising and Appreciative Education. Connect via LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennifer-jenny-bloom-1873487/ Mykel Beorchia Mykel Beorchia uses Appreciative Education as a framework for cultivating spaces centered on possibilities for students and educators. Mykel started as the Director of the Office of Appreciative Education at Florida Atlantic University in 2024. As Executive Director of University and Exploratory Advising at Utah State University (2016-2024), Mykel infused Appreciative Education practices throughout the advising system. She is dedicated to building connections and empowering others to amplify their strengths to create advising relationships with students and achieve personal, unit, and institutional goals. She served as chair of the NACADA Appreciative Advising Community from 2021-2023. Connect via LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mykelbeorchia Ashley Weinkoff Ashley Weinkoff serves as the Coordinator for the Office of Appreciative Education at Florida Atlantic University. She is dedicated to supporting educational and professional development initiatives that utilize a positive, strengths-based, and student-centered approach to helping students realize their full potential. Ashley graduated cum laude from University of Maryland with a Bachelor of Science in Kinesiology and continued her education at Towson University where she earned a Master of Science in Occupational Therapy and Florida Atlantic University where she earned a Master of Education in Higher Education Leadership. Connect via LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ashley-weinkoff/ Staff Associates Steve Sanderson Steve Sanderson is a Staff Associate with the Office of Appreciative Education and is a veteran of the Illinois Army National Guard. Steve grew in Champaign-Urbana, Illinois, and received a degree in Accounting from Eastern Illinois University. He retired from Administration at the University of Illinois and later worked as a Corporate Pilot for a Vesuvius USA, a company based in Champaign. Steve also worked as a Flight Instructor and a charter pilot, both in Illinois and in South Carolina. He holds the Airline Transport Pilot rating. After moving to Florida, Steve spent five years with the Office of New Student Orientation and Family Engagement, and has served in various capacities for all of the Summer Institutes. Steve is a Certified Appreciative Adviser and works with many of the other OAE programs. Connect via LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/steve-sanderson-15730511/ Ed Morrison Ed Morrison is a Staff Associate with the Office of Appreciative Education and is a veteran of the U.S. Army Reserves.  Ed grew up in West Virginia and received a degree in Mathematics from The University of Toledo.  He had a career in Information Technology as a software developer for Owens Illinois, Inc. a glass company and then with Holcim, Inc. a cement manufacturing company.  After moving to Florida, Ed spent two years with the Office of New Student Orientation and Family Engagement and has served in various capacities with the Office of Appreciative Education.  Ed has joined the team in the Zoom Broadcast Engineer control room helping with the Summer Institutes and many other OAE programs. International Services Staff | Florida Atlantic University Skip to main content FLORIDA ATLANTIC UNIVERSITY students faculty/staff alumni families apply visit give FAU Home Center for Global Engagement International Student Services International Services Staff MENU Home FAU Homepage Center For Global Engagement About Our Team What We Do Reports and Statistics Contact Us Prospective Students Admissions Overview Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Cost of Attendance Internal Foreign Credential Evaluation Newly Admitted Students Admissions Pre-Arrival Informations Documents for Student Visa Cost of Attendance Orientation and Check-In Enrollment Information Q&A Sessions Current Students F-1 Students J-1 Students Other Non-Immigrant Students Health Insurance Information Curricular Practical Training (CPT) Optional Practical Training (OPT) SEVIS Forms Forms Resources Resources International Student Services SUB MENU About What we do Annual Report Our Team Contact Us Resources Our Team On behalf of the International Studnet Services team, it is a pleasure to welcome you to Florida Atlantic University (FAU). We host more than 1200 international students, scholars and their families representing more than 110 countries. Our goal is to ensure that you have a positive and productive experience while at Florida Atlantic, and  along with reaching your academic objectives  that you enjoy our international university community and campus life. We are here to assist you with a wide range of important and practical information and to help make your transition into our university community as smooth as possible. The International Student Services office is located on the Boca Raton Campus. Mission To provide the high-quality services, that ensure regulatory compliance, support international enrollment growth, and facilitate cultural adjustment and integration of international students, scholars, and their families. To serves as an integral part of the Universitys efforts of internationalization. To ensure our team members are treated with deep respect, compassion, and kindness so that we establish a safe working surrounding where each individual has opportunity to grow, and where we can feel a greater purpose and synergy as a team. Vision The International Student Services (ISS) unit within the Center for Global Engagement serves as the catalyst for the universitys internationalization and global outreach endeavors. Values Competence, Integrity, Leadership, and Teamwork Dr. Mihaela N.
